title: When to Visit And What to Enjoy in Kanyakumari
text:
When to Visit And What to Enjoy in Kanyakumari When to Visit And What to Enjoy in Kanyakumari 0 
Kanyakumari, perhaps the most exotic and pictorial destination in India, located at the tip of southern part of India. One can be amazed to see the picturesque convergence of Indian Ocean, Arabian Sea and Bay of Bengal. It is famous for its diversified culture that reflects into its art, crafts and architecture. Visitors find countless attractions here- sacred temples, churches, majestic forts, royal palaces, massive monuments and exotic museums. It does not end here; one can also be flabbergasted by its serene beaches, alluring sunrise and sunset, extraordinary view of sun and moon sharing a horizon. 
Every year Kanyakumari witnesses large number tourists from across India as well from foreign countries and plays a vital role in Tamil Nadu tourism. Although, Kanyakumari enjoys moderate climate throughout the year but the ideal time to visit this incredible destination is between October to March, when temperature is 25 degrees to 30 degree Celsius. During summer, April to June, the weather becomes too hot and the temperature rises to 35 to 38 degree Celsius, which may cause trouble to the tourists. Also during monsoon (Jul- Sept), it enjoys heavy rainfall and the climate become too much humid, so not the best time to visit. However, while visiting Kanyakumari one should not miss to do the following things: Watching the alluring Sunrise & Sunset: It is suggested to see the most amazing and breath-taking view of Sunrise and Sunset in Kanyakumari. There are different points for the perfect view of this extraordinary moment. Tourists can enjoy the perfect Sunrise from the corner of the beach, in front of Vivekananda Rock memorial whereas sunset can be seen from View tower. Huge visitors are gathering in the morning since 5 am and waiting to see this spectacular sight and same is applicable in the evening. Trekking at Marunthuvazh Malai: Marunthuvazh Malai, is considered to be one of the most preferred destinations for trekking in Kanyakumari; surrounded by tranquil seas. Plenty of Coconut grooves and rarest medicinal plants and herbs enhance the beauty of this place. One must go for trekking in this place while visiting in Kanyakumari to enjoy the mesmerizing natural symphony. It is located about 11 kms away from Nagercoil and 7 kms from Kanyakumari at the tip of the Western Ghats. It takes approx 2 hours for trekkers to reach at the extreme top and one should carry some food and water along with him. Visiting the sacred Temples: Tour at Kanyakumari without visiting its holy temples, is considered as incomplete tour. Since more than a decade, Kanyakumari is the favourite pilgrimage destination in India. It is the hub of many sacred temples, holy gods and virgin goddesses; most importantly the name of this place was done after the Goddess Kanyakumari Amman, who was believed to be here. There are lot famous temples in Kanyakumari- Kumari Amman temple, Suchindram Thanumalayan Temple, Thirunandikarai Cave Temple, Nagaraja Temple, Veli Malai Kumarakoil Temple, Bhoothalingaswamy Temple, Thiruvattaru Adhikeshvaran Temple. One can get relieve from all of his worries, sorrows, depression and sins by visiting these holy temples and get lifetime experience of spirituality and enlightenment. The famous sage, spiritual teacher and prophet Swami Vivekananda also came here in the search of spirituality and enlightenment and sat for meditation for a prolonged period and got the enlightenment finally. Shopping in Kanyakumari: As Kanyakumari is enriched with its culture and tradition, which in turn can be also seen in its architecture, arts and crafts. Souvenirs from Kanyakumari include a wide variety of items made from Sea Shells and extraordinarily crafted antiques. Visitors can buy beautiful sea shell ornaments, conches, straw hats and clips made from coconut shells. Apart from that various beautifully crafted decorative and antique pieces, handloom saris; silk saris are also popular souvenirs, which can be brought as a token of memory. One should grab the opportunity to go for a shopping while visiting Kanyakumari and bring some memories with him, which may remind him about his beautiful and unforgettable journey. Mouth-watering food of Kanyakumari: While tripping to Kanyakumari, one should enjoy and relish the delicious cuisine of Kanyakumari which represents its tradition while. The food here is generally hot and spicy, cooked in coconut oil with full of coconuts and curry leaves. This includes Coconut rice, Sambar, Rasam, Meen Kolumbu (fish curry with coconut), Avial (vegetables cooked with coconut). Festivals in Kanyakumari: One should plan to travel to Kanyakumari during October as it is not only the ideal season to visit, but visitor can enjoy the colourful festivals like Cape Comorin festival and Navaratri festival during this period. Cape Comorin is three day event, celebrated in a grand manner and performed various songs, cultural programs and dance; that represents their culture and tradition. In October, Navaratri- Festival of Goddess Durga is celebrated with various traditional customs, cultural programs and temples are decorated with flowers. 
Kanyakumari, the most incredible tourist destinations in India, has obtained its popularity as a tourist destination for both its striking natural exquisiteness and its sacredness as a pilgrimage site. Undoubtedly, one can definitely get fascinated by its picturesque beauty and able to refresh his mind from all stress, worries, sufferings and sins by visiting this divine place. In his lifetime, one should at least try once to visit the extraordinary unique destination. To get a delighted and lifetime memorable experience, one must visit and things to do in Kanyakumari in the month of October. Rate this Article
